page.title: 13TRENGWAINTON GARDENS.
page.content: Trengwainton Gardens is a National Trust property in the village of Heamoor.It is famous for its rhodo- dendron bushes and trees and azalea bushes;especially beautiful at Spring- time when they are in bloom.There is a long drive which leads up to the house about half a mile long with wooded walks on either side. Running through the grounds is a small stream,which also flows past the old infants' school in Heamoor. Some of the many different plants can only grow in the South West of England because of the mild damp climate.There is a Mexican bush,planted by Princess Anne when she visited Cornwall. The house is occupied by Major S. Bolitho.Local groups and societies have fetes and bands hold concerts there at week-ends.The gardens are officially open from Easter until Oct.
